item.title: co add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: co add a quote by Rodney Dangerfield
item.description: "I came from a real tough neighborhood. Once a guy pulled a knife on me. I knew he wasn't a professional, the knife had butter on it." -- Rodney Dangerfield

item.title: co add a quote by Robert Orben
item.description: "Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian." -- Robert Orben

item.title: co add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Those who dance are considered insane by those who cannot hear the music." -- George Carlin

item.title: co add a quote by Don Marquis
item.description: "Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday" -- Don Marquis

item.title: co add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'd rather be a rising ape than a falling angel." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: co add a quote by Fernando Pessoa
item.description: "No intelligent idea can gain general acceptance unless some stupidity is mixed in with it" -- Fernando Pessoa

item.title: co add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I sent the club a wire stating, PLEASE ACCEPT MY RESIGNATION. I DON'T WANT TO BELONG TO ANY CLUB THAT WILL ACCEPT ME AS A MEMBER." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: co add a quote by Peter Ustinov
item.description: "I imagine hell like this: Italian punctuality, German humour and English wine." -- Peter Ustinov

item.title: co add a quote by Rodney Dangerfield
item.description: "Once I pulled a job, I was so stupid. I picked a guy's pocket on an airplane and made a run for it." -- Rodney Dangerfield

item.title: co add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Over the centuries, mankind has tried many ways of combating the forces of evil... prayer, fasting, good works and so on. Up until Doom, no one seemed to have thought about the double-barrel shotgun. Eat leaden death, demon..." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: co add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: co add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A woman, especially if she have the misfortune of knowing anything, should conceal it as well as she can." -- Jane Austen

item.title: co add a quote by Rowena Cherry
co add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "There's an old joke - um... two elderly women are at a Catskill mountain resort, and one of 'em says, "Boy, the food at this place is really terrible." The other one says, "Yeah, I know; and such small portions." Well, that's essentially how I feel about life - full of loneliness, and misery, and suffering, and unhappiness, and it's all over much too quickly." -- Woody Allen

item.title: co add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Life in a box is better than no life at all, I expect. You'd have a chance at least. You could lie there thinking: Well, at least I'm not dead." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: co add a quote by LM Montgomery
item.description: "After all, what could you expect from a pig but a grunt?" -- LM Montgomery

item.title: co add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "My patience has dreadful chilblains from standing so long on a monument." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: co add a quote by Kingsley Amis
item.description: "... all his faces were designed to express rage or loathing. Now that something had happened which really deserved a face, he had none to celebrate it with. As a kind of token, he made his Sex Life in Ancient Rome face." -- Kingsley Amis

item.title: co add a quote by Kay Redfield Jamison
item.description: "Mother, who has an absolute belief that it is not the cards that one is dealt in life, it is how one plays them, is, by far, the highest card I was dealt." -- Kay Redfield Jamison

item.title: co add a quote by Doris Day
item.description: "The really frightening thing about middle age is that you know you'll grow out of it. " -- Doris Day

item.title: co add a quote by Rowena Cherry
item.description:
"If you neglected to warn Djetth beforehand that you were going to shoot him down, Your Highness, he may consider you in breach of contract...
<i>-- Rhett</i>" -- Rowena Cherry

item.title: co add a quote by John Kennedy Toole
item.description: "Had that poor Reilly kook really been proud of Levy Pants? He had always said that he was. That was one good sign of his insanity." -- John Kennedy Toole

item.title: co add a quote by Rowena Cherry
item.description: "<i>Rhett:</i> If you've made up your mind to impale someone, do it with conviction." -- Rowena Cherry

item.title: co add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "If I'm out of my mind, it's all right with me, thought Moses Herzog." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: co add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "Prediction is very difficult, especially about the future." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: co add a quote by Karen Joy Fowler
item.description: "Allegra's Austen wrote about the impact of financial need on the intimate lives of women. If she'd worked in a bookstore, Allegra would have shelved Austen in the horror section." -- Karen Joy Fowler

item.title: co add a quote by John Kennedy Toole
item.description:
"It smells terrible in here.'
Well, what do you expect? The human body, when confined, produces certain odors which we tend to forget in this age of deodorants and other perversions. Actually, I find the atmosphere of this room rather comforting. Schiller needed the scent of apples rotting in his desk in order to write. I, too, have my needs. You may remember that Mark Twain preferred to lie supinely in bed while composing those rather dated and boring efforts which contemporary scholars try to prove meaningful. Veneration of Mark Twain is one of the roots of our current intellectual stalemate." -- John Kennedy Toole

item.title: co add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "Doctor doctor, what do you say, lets put the id back in yid" -- Philip Roth
